@description.name: @description

@type.name: @type
@type.body:
{Boolean} Result of {@link #hasPhp}. Stored as class member to avoid
repeating the check.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application has been loaded over HTTP.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the server supports PHP.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if PHP is supported by the backend
@return.description: true if PHP is supported by the backend

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application extends qx.application.Standalone

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the application is a standalone (GUI) application
@return.description: true if the application is a standalone (GUI) application

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application extends qx.application.Inline

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the application is an inline application
@return.description: true if the application is an inline application

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application extends qx.application.Native

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the application is a native application
@return.description: true if the application is a native application

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is running in Google Chrome

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the browser is Google Chrome
@return.description: true if the browser is Google Chrome

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is running in Firefox

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is running in a browser using the Gecko engine

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the browser engine is Mozilla Gecko
@return.description: true if the browser engine is Mozilla Gecko

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is running in Internet Explorer

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the browser is Internet Explorer
@return.description: true if the browser is Internet Explorer

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is running in a browser using the MSHTML engine

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the browser engine is MSHTML
@return.description: true if the browser engine is MSHTML

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is running in a browser using the Opera engine

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the browser engine is Opera
@return.description: true if the browser engine is Opera

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is running in a browser using the Webkit engine

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the browser engine is Webkit
@return.description: true if the browser engine is Webkit

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is NOT running on OS X

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the operating system is NOT OX X
@return.description: true if the operating system is NOT OX X

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is running on Windows 7

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is running on Windows 10

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is not running in a Google Chrome browser on Linux

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the browser is not Google Chrome on Linux
@return.description: true if the browser is not Google Chrome on Linux

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Checks if the application is running on a client supporting async functions

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Boolean} true if the client supports async functions
@return.description: true if the client supports async functions

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Verifies a list of infrastructure requirements by checking for corresponding "has" methods. If no such method was found, {@link qx.core.Environment} will be checked for a key matching the given feature name. Note that asynchronous environment checks are not supported! See the manual for further details: Defining Test Requirements

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if no valid check was found for a feature.
@throws.description: if no valid check was found for a feature.
